briefdescription.para: The default constructor.

detaileddescription.para: Leaves object in an unusable state. A "define" method must be called before use.

memberdef.argsstring: (const Box &dom, const RealBox *rb=nullptr, int coord=-1, int const *is_per=nullptr) noexcept
memberdef.name: Geometry

detaileddescription.para: Constructs a fully-defined geometry object that describes the problem domain and coordinate system.

parameterdescription.para: cell-centered Box specifying the index space bounds of the domain.
A pointer to a RealBox specifying the real space bounds of the domain. Optional. If not specified, will be ParmParsed from "geometry.prob_lo" and "geometry.prob_hi".
Specifies the coordinate system type. Optional. Can be one of: CoordSys::cartesian CoordSys::RZ CoordSys::SPHERICAL Default is cartesian.
pointer to memory space specifying periodicity in each coordinate direction. Optional. Default is non-periodic.

memberdef.argsstring: (const Box &dom, const RealBox &rb, int coord, Array< int, 3 > const &is_per) noexcept
memberdef.name: Geometry

detaileddescription.para: Constructs a fully-defined geometry object that describes the problem domain and coordinate system.

parameterdescription.para: cell-centered Box specifying the index space bounds of the domain.
A pointer to a RealBox specifying the real space bounds of the domain. Optional. If not specified, will be ParmParsed from "geometry.prob_lo" and "geometry.prob_hi".
Specifies the coordinate system type. Optional. Can be one of: CoordSys::cartesian CoordSys::RZ CoordSys::SPHERICAL Default is cartesian.
amrex::Array specifying periodicity in each coordinate direction. Optional. Default is non-periodic.

briefdescription.para: Returns non-static copy of geometry's stored data.

memberdef.argsstring: (const Box &dom, const RealBox *rb=nullptr, int coord=-1, int const *is_per=nullptr) noexcept
memberdef.name: define

detaileddescription.para: Defines a geometry object that describes the problem domain and coordinate system for rectangular problem domains. Useful for when the Geometry object has been constructed with the default constructor.

parameterdescription.para: cell-centered Box specifying the index space bounds of the domain.
A pointer to a RealBox specifying the real space bounds of the domain. Optional. If not specified, will be ParmParsed from "geometry.prob_lo" and "geometry.prob_hi".
Specifies the coordinate system type. Optional. Can be one of: CoordSys::cartesian CoordSys::RZ CoordSys::SPHERICAL Default is cartesian.
pointer to memory space specifying periodicity in each coordinate direction. Optional. Default is non-periodic.

memberdef.argsstring: (const Box &dom, const RealBox &rb, int coord, Array< int, 3 > const &is_per) noexcept
memberdef.name: define

detaileddescription.para: Defines a geometry object that describes the problem domain and coordinate system for rectangular problem domains. Useful for when the Geometry object has been constructed with the default constructor.

parameterdescription.para: cell-centered Box specifying the index space bounds of the domain.
A pointer to a RealBox specifying the real space bounds of the domain. Optional. If not specified, will be ParmParsed from "geometry.prob_lo" and "geometry.prob_hi".
Specifies the coordinate system type. Optional. Can be one of: CoordSys::cartesian CoordSys::RZ CoordSys::SPHERICAL Default is cartesian.
amrex::Array specifying periodicity in each coordinate direction. Optional. Default is non-periodic.

briefdescription.para: Is the domain periodic in the specified direction?
Is domain periodic in any direction?
Is domain periodic in all directions?
What's period in specified direction?

memberdef.argsstring: (const Box &target, const Box &src, Vector< IntVect > &out) const noexcept
memberdef.name: periodicShift

briefdescription.para: Compute Array of shifts which will translate src so that it will intersect target with non-zero intersection. the array will be resized internally, so anything previously there will be gone DO NOT return non-periodic shifts, even if the box's do intersect without shifting. The logic is that you will only do this as a special case if there is some periodicity.
Return domain box with non-periodic directions grown by ngrow.
Return domain box with non-periodic directions grown by ngrow.
Return domain box with periodic directions grown by ngrow.
Return domain box with periodic directions grown by ngrow.

detaileddescription.para: Set periodicity flags and return the old flags. Note that, unlike Periodicity class, the flags are just boolean.

memberdef.argsstring: (ParticleReal x, ParticleReal y, ParticleReal z) const
memberdef.name: outsideRoundoffDomain

briefdescription.para: Returns true if a point is outside the roundoff domain. All particles with positions inside the roundoff domain are sure to be mapped to cells inside the Domain() box. Note that the same need not be true for all points inside ProbDomain().

memberdef.argsstring: (ParticleReal x, ParticleReal y, ParticleReal z) const
memberdef.name: insideRoundoffDomain

briefdescription.para: Returns true if a point is inside the roundoff domain. All particles with positions inside the roundoff domain are sure to be mapped to cells inside the Domain() box. Note that the same need not be true for all points inside ProbDomain().
Compute the roundoff domain. Public because it contains an extended host / device lambda.
Returns roundoff domain's lower end.
Returns roundoff domain's higher end.

Rectangular problem domain geometry.

detaileddescription.para: This class describes problem domain and coordinate system for RECTANGULAR problem domains. Since the problem domain is RECTANGULAR, periodicity is meaningful.
